list_definition.definition: to keep throwing in the air and catching a number of objects (eg balls or clubs)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He entertained the audience by juggling with four balls and four plates at once.

list_ex_of_english: The community interpreter has to be able to juggle this kind of information all the time.
No amount of juggling with figures can disguise the low pay of these workers.
One cannot deal with human beings by juggling with statistics.
No juggling with the existing numbers of units will solve the problem.
Should the regulations provide that all those factors be juggled in one combination or another?
They are juggling with the question in every speech they make and apologising for having left us.
Four males wheeled out prams to sound effects of screaming babies, and in a very funny act, juggled crying babies on short sticks.
Indeed, the main mechanism by which working carers juggle work and care seems to be to provide relatively few hours of care.
